This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

A sphere of mass <math alttext="M"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is attached to one end of a rigid stick of negligible mass. The other end of the stick is fixed in place so that the sphere can move in a circular path of radius <math alttext="R"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in Figure 1.

(a) The sphere is released from rest with the stick at an angle of 60 degrees from the vertical, as shown in Figure 2. Derive an expression for the speed of the sphere when it is at point <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the bottommost point of the circular path.

(b) An external force is exerted on the sphere to speed it up. After the force is removed, the sphere has enough speed to move in a complete circle, as shown in Figure 3. The angle <math alttext="theta"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to zero when the sphere is at point <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and is 180 degrees when the sphere is at point <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the topmost point of the circular path.

i. On the axes shown, sketch a possible graph of the potential energy of the sphere-Earth system as a function of <math alttext="theta"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Label the graph “<math alttext="U"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.”

ii. On the same axes, sketch a possible graph of the kinetic energy of the sphere as a function of the <math alttext="theta "><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Label this graph “<math alttext="K"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.”

iii. When the sphere makes a complete revolution around its circular path, does it spend more time in the top half of the circle, more time in the bottom half of the circle, or the same amount of time in both halves of the circle?

Briefly state your reasoning.
